snail; Taiwan pr. [gua1]; see 蜗牛 [wo1 niu2]

rtega_mnemonic:
螺螺RS䗾蝸蠃螺𧷳𩮹 spiral shell, conch, spiral
  • snake like 虫 creature living in a shell that's accumulated 累 over time
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 蜗)
Pictophonetic: 咼 indicates the sound; 虫 (mollusk) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
蝸牛 [ wō niú ]: snail; Taiwan pr. [gua1 niu2]
蝸居 [ wō jū ]: humble abode; to live (in a tiny, cramped space)
蝸桿 [ wō gǎn ]: worm (mechanical engineering)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 虫 [ chóng ] insect, worm; mollusk
    • 咼 [ guō ] to chat, to gossip, to jaw, to talk; mouth
heisig_chinese_memo: Insects are mostly mushy little creatures which can be squashed easily but the snail should be nicknamed the jawbone insect because its got that tough shell on the outside.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the insect (虫) that gossips (咼) is a snail
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The snail has a different kind of esophagus from any other insect.  It's just a big glob for goodness sake!
humanum_full_description_en: From the sound of " worm " and "咼", the original meaning is snail. "Shuowen": "Snails. From insects, 咼声." "Zhuangzi‧ Zeyang": "There are so-called snails, you know what?" Cheng Xuanyingshu: "Snails, insect names, there are small snails Also; the yellow calf is commonly called the snail, and it has four horns."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " worm " and "咼", the original meaning is snail.
humanum_full_description: 從「虫」，「咼」聲，本義為蝸牛。《說文》：「蝸蠃也。从虫，咼聲。」《莊子‧則陽》：「有所謂蝸者，君知之乎？」成玄英疏：「蝸者，蟲名，有類小螺也；俗謂之黃犢，亦謂之蝸牛，有四角。」

Kanshudo mnemonic:the insect (虫) that gossips (咼) is a snail
Chinese: Insects are mostly mushy little creatures which can be squashed easily but the snail should be nicknamed the jawbone insect because its got that tough shell on the outside.
Meaning: snail
Hanzi: 蜗
Story: The snail has a different kind of esophagus from any other insect. It's just a big glob for goodness sake!
Kind: traditional

從「 虫 」，「 咼 」聲，本義為蝸牛。《說文》：「蝸蠃也。从虫，咼聲。」《莊子‧則陽》：「有所謂蝸者，君知之乎？」成玄英疏：「蝸者，蟲名，有類小螺也；俗謂之黃犢，亦謂之蝸牛，有四角。」
From the sound of " worm" and " 咼", the original meaning is snail. "Shuowen": "Snails. From insects, 咼声." "Zhuangzi‧ Zeyang": "There are so-called snails, you know what?" Cheng Xuanyingshu: "Snails, insect names, there are small snails Also; the yellow calf is commonly called the snail, and it has four horns."

蝸字的基本解释

蝸
wō
见“蜗”。

蝸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wō］
［《廣韻》古蛙切，平佳，見。］
［《廣韻》古華切，平麻，見。］
“蜗1”的繁体字。
蜗牛。
[②]［wā］
［《廣韻》古蛙切，平佳，見。］
通“媧2”。“蜗2”的繁体字。
[③]［luó］
［《集韻》盧戈切，平戈，來。］
“蜗3”的繁体字。
见“蝸3醢”、“蝸3旋”。
[④]［guō］
［《集韻》古禾切，平戈，見。］
通“瘑1”。“蜗4”的繁体字。

蝸字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　蝸； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页1091第29
【唐韻】【韻會】【正韻】?古華切，音瓜。【說文】蝸蠃也。【爾雅·釋魚】蚹蠃，螔蝓。【註】卽蝸牛也。【疏】按《本草》陶註云：生山中及人家，頭形似蛣蝓，但背負殻爾。【古今注】蝸牛，陵螺也。殻如小螺，熱則自懸葉下。野人結圓舍如蝸牛之殻，故曰蝸舍，蝸殻宛轉有文章。【莊子·則陽篇】有國于蝸牛之左角者曰觸氏，有國于蝸牛之右角者曰蠻氏。【郭璞·江賦】鸚螺?蝸。　又【韻會】公蛙切，音騧。與媧通。【禮·明堂位】女蝸之笙簧。　又古禾切，音戈。《莊子》郭象註讀戈。

考證：〔【爾雅·釋蟲】蚹蠃，螔蝓。〕　謹照原書釋蟲改釋魚。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　Snail; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 1091 Page 29
[Tang Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] [Positive Rhyme]? Gu Huaqie, sound melon. [Said the text] Snail also. 【Erya·Shiyu】worms, worms. [Note] Also snails. 【Sparse】According to "Materia Medica" Tao Zhuyun: I live in the mountains and other people, the head looks like a worm, but bears a shell. [Ancient and modern note] snails, mausoleum snails are also. The shell is like a small snail, and the heat hangs under the leaf. The savage knot round house is like a snail's shell, so it is called a snail house, and the volute is full of articles. [Zhuangzi·Zeyang Chapter] Those who have a country in the left corner of the snail are called the Shushi, and those who have a country in the right corner of the snail are called the Man. [Guo Pu·Jiang Fu] Parrot? Snail.　[Yunhui] The male frog cuts, the sound is 騧. Connect with Wa. 【Rite·Mingtang】The sheng spring of the female snail.　Guo Heqi again, Yin Ge. "Zhuangzi" Guo Xiang's Notes on Ge. Textual research: [[Erya·Release insects] worms, worms. 〕　I would like to change the release of fish according to the original book.
